intro: Cecropia glauca, commonly known as the white cecropia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, lowland environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glaucous bark and large, heart-shaped leaves with a prominent midrib. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically greenish-yellow in color. Cecropia glauca is often found in secondary forests and can be a pioneer species in disturbed habitats.
